keyTakeAways: A man named Billy Joe Cagle, a convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, planned to shoot up Atlanta’s busiest airport via a social media livestream.
Cagle had possession of an AR-15 assault rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition, which was discovered in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the airport terminal.
The incident was averted due to a family member providing a tip to law enforcement, demonstrating the importance of community vigilance and early intervention.
Cagle was arrested at the airport after being identified by police via a photo provided by family; body-camera footage shows his arrest and audible yelling during detention.

Cagle has been charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, possession of a firearm during the commission of a felony, and possession of a firearm by a felon.
The case underscores the role of mental health awareness, especially in individuals with diagnoses like schizophrenia, and the need for community support systems.
Federal authorities are investigating how Cagle obtained the firearm, which law enforcement states he was not legally allowed to possess.
The incident was widely praised as averted due to timely reporting and coordinated law enforcement action, including input from local and federal agencies.

summaryOfNewsArticle: A 49-year-old convicted felon from Cartersville, Georgia, Billy Joe Cagle, was arrested at Hartsfield-Jackson Atlanta International Airport after his family alerted law enforcement that he had streamed on social media a plan to 'shoot it up' at the airport. Officers found an AR-15 rifle and 27 rounds of ammunition in his Chevrolet pickup truck parked outside the terminal. The incident was averted thanks to early reporting by family members, and Cagle has been charged with making terroristic threats, criminal attempt to commit aggravated assault, and possession of a firearm by a felon. Authorities are investigating how he legally obtained the firearm, which he was not authorized to possess. The case underscores the importance of community vigilance, mental health awareness, and coordinated law enforcement response in preventing violent acts at critical public infrastructure locations.
title: Man Arrested at Atlanta Airport After Threatening to Shoot Up the Terminal on Social Media
